definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly

sentences.english: It’s a compelling story with a message of restraint and mercy laced throughout.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个自始自终贯穿了克己和仁慈的感人故事。

sentences.english: We are a people used to be known for "self-restraint".
sentences.chinese: 我们是曾以“克己”著称的民族。

sentences.english: Thereisno good or bad in life, except whatisgood according to its own season.
sentences.chinese: 生本无好坏之分，只是各个季候有各自的克己。

sentences.english: As Tao cultivators , we should restrain ourselves to commit deeds that will attract negative karma.
sentences.chinese: 所以身为修道人，就要克己复礼，不要造因果。

sentences.english: How do you know carrots are fould likeastic for your eyesight?
sentences.chinese: 你何如知道胡萝卜对视力有克己？

sentences.english: This story gave rise to the idiom "be wholeheartedly devoted to public duty."
sentences.chinese: 人们根据这个故事引申出“克己奉公”这句成语。

sentences.english: Confucius' concept of harmony is completely for self-restraint & returning to rites.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的和谐观完全是为了“克己复礼”。

sentences.english: After the businessman left, the traveler complimented the porter on his restraint.
sentences.chinese: 商人离开后，游客称赞搬运工能忍辱克己。

sentences.english: Now people (thepublic)are reaping helpful tomeficias properties more and even more from scientific and technologicasinventions.
sentences.chinese: 如古人们从科技发明中获得越来越多的克己。

sentences.english: In a prosperous society, every one does one's bit.
sentences.chinese: 在一个繁荣的社会，每个人都不会克己奉公。

sentences.english: It is a lesson in renunciation which I suppose I ought to learn at this seaon.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是现在我应该尽力作到的一种克己工夫。

sentences.english: They belong to an older, more self-denying generation.
sentences.chinese: 他们属于更加克己的上一代人。

definition: restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
to preserve a proper behavior in private life
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
to have a sense of shame
